section.title: Notes
section.item: The psalms of the day are sung or read antiphonally.
Songs/canticles' may be sung or said antiphonally.
An alternative declaration of pardon as well as an alternative form of benediction are provided for use by a lay minister in the absence of a minister.

Offering: In this as well as other services, the leader is encouraged to first exhort the Christians give generously for the Lord's work by reading and explaining texts related to giving and stewardship.

section.rubric: At the entry of the procession the people stand. A hymn is sung after which the people remain standing and the leader welcomes them with the following words.
section.item: The Lord be with you.
And also with you.

We have come together, the people of God, drawn by his Spirit, longing for his word, to praise the holy name of the Lord, to share his glorious news of grace, to pray for our needs and the pain of the world, to rejoice in his love and be sent into his peace.
We are heirs of the Father;
joint heirs with the son,
renewed in the spirit,
together we are one.

section.title: Sentences
section.rubric: One or more of these sentences may be said after the introduction.
section.item: Ezekiel 18:27 If a wicked man turns away from the wickedness he has committed and does what is just and right, he will save his life.
Joel 2:13 Rend your heart and not your garments. Return to the Lord your God for he is gracious and compassionate, slow to anger and abounding in love, and he relents from sending calamity.
Psalm 37:4 Delight yourself in the Lord and he will give you the desires of your heart.
Psalm 36:9 For with you is the fountain of life; in your light we see light.
Psalm 84:2 My soul yearns, even faints, for the courts of teh Lord; My heart and my flesh cry out for the living God.
Psalm 63:1 God you are my God, early will I seek you: O God, you are my God, earnestly I seek you; my sould thirsts for you, my body longs for you.
Psalm 73:25 Whom have I in heaven but you? And earth has nothing I desire besides you.
Isaiah 1;16-17 Wash and make yourself clean. Take your evil deeds out of my sight! Stop doing wrong and learn to do right!
Isaiah 2:3 "Come, let us go up to the mountain of the Lord,... he will teach us his ways so that we may walk in his paths."
Isaiah 65:24 Before they call I will answer; while they are still speaking I will hear.'
Isaiah 66:2 This is the one I esteem: he who is humble and contrite in spirit and trembles at my word.
Micah 6:8 And what does the Lord require of you? To act justly and to love mercy and to walk humbly with your God.
Matthew 5:17 Do not think that I have come to abolish the law or the prophets; I have not come to abolish them but to fulfill them.

Luke 6:20-22 Blessed are you who are poor, for yours is the Kingdom of God. Blessed are you who hunger, for you will be satisfied. Blessed are you who weep now, for you will laugh. Blessed are you when people hate you,... because great is your reward in heaven.
Luke 12:32 Fear not, little flock, for it is your Father's good pleasure to give you the kingdom.
Luke 15:7 "I tell you there will be more rejoicing in heaven over one sinner who repents, than over ninety-nine righteous persons who do not need to repent."
Luke 15:18 "Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you. I am no longer worthy to be called your son."

If we say that we have no sin we deceive ourselves and the truth is not in us. If we confess our sins, in repentance and trust, God is faithful and just, and will forgive us our sins. So let us confess them to our Father.
People kneel.

Eternal Father, God of our ancestors, before your power all things tremble, but through your son, we approach your throne. We have done wrong and neglected to do right; our sins weigh heavily on our hearts: Lord have mercy, count them not against us. Grant us the joy of forgiveness and lighten our hearts with the glory of Christ, who died and rose again for us. Amen.

The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ rejoices at repentance and declares his acceptance. The dead are alive, the lost are found. His goodness and mercy will follow you all the days of your life, and you will live in the house of the Lord for ever.
Amen.

section.rubric: When a minister is not present the lay leader is to use the following prayer.
section.item: Lord of mercy, grant us your pardon and peace; that cleansed from our sins and with peace in our hearts, we may be free to serve you; through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.
Amen.
Blessed are those who live in your house.
They will always be singing your praise.
Praise the Lord.
The name of the Lord be praised.

section.rubric: People stand.
section.item: Glory to the Father in whom all things began.
Glory to the Son who became the son of man, Glory to the Spirit who inspires and renews. The Lord our God for ever! Alleluia!

section.rubric: Between Christmas and Epiphany Sunday, and between Easter Day and Pentecost Sunday, the following version of the Gloria may be said instead of the above.
section.item: The glorious Son of God on high
is born for us through Mary's womb:
The homeless Prince of Peace on earth
is crushed and lies in Joseph's tomb
The reigning Lord of Life and death
breaks the bonds of time and doom.

section.title: Jubilate Song, Vinite, or the Song of Habakkuk

item.title: Jubilate Song (Song of Joy)
item.stanza: I will enter his gates with thanksgiving in my heart:
I will enter his courts with praise.
I will say this is the day that the Lord has made:
I will rejoice for he has made me glad.
He has made me glad, he has made me glad:
I will rejoice for he has made me glad.
He has made me glad, he has made me glad:
I will rejoice for he has made me glad.

item.title: Venite (Song of Triumph)
item.stanza: O come, let us sing out to the Lord;
let us shout in triumph to the Rock of our salvation.
Let us come before his face with thanksgiving:
and cry to him joyfully in psalms.
For the Lord is a great God:
and a great King above all gods.
In his hand are the depths of the earth:
and the peaks of the mountains are his also.
The sea is his and he made it:
his hands moulded dry land.
Come let us worship and bow down:
and kneel before the Lord our maker.
For he is the Lord our God:
we are his people and the sheep of his pasture.
If only you would hear his voice today:
for he comes to judge the earth.
He shall judge the world with righteousness:
and the peoples with his truth.

item.title: Song of Habakkuk
item.stanza: Though the mango tree does not blossom
nor the fruit be on the vines,
the crop of the coconut fails,
and the fields yield no food,
Though the flock be cut off from the fold.
and there be no herd in the stall,
yet I will rejoice in the Lord,
I will be joyful in the God of my salvation
Glory to the Father, Son and the Holy Spirit: as it was in the beginning, is now and ever shall be. Amen.

section.title: Zaburi ya Siku
section.rubric: The PSALM appointed for the day may be sung or said antiphonally and should end with:
section.item: Glory to the Father, Son and the Holy Spirit: as it was in the beginning, is now and ever shall be. Amen.

section.title: FIRST READING from the Old Testament
section.rubric: At the end of the reading the reader says:
section.item: This is the word of the Lord.
Thanks be to God.

section.title: Song of the Messiah, Song of Zecharaiah, or the Song of Paul

item.title: Song of the Messiah
item.stanza: Jesus the Seed of Abraham blesses the nations:
Jesus the Prophet like Moses frees the oppressed:
Jesus the Lord of King David leads his people:
Jesus the Servant of the Lord suffers and Saves:
Jesus the Son of Man destroyed and raised.
Glory to the Father, Son, and the Holy Spirit; as it was in the beginning, is now and ever shall be. Amen.

item.title: Song of Zecharaiah
item.stanza: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel:
for he has come to his people and set them free.
He has raised up for us a mighty Saviour:
born of the house of his servant David.
Through his holy prophets he promised of old:
that he would save us from our enemies,
from the hands of all that hate us.
He promised to show mercy to our fathers:
and to remember his holy covenant.
This was the oath he swore to our father Abraham:
to set us free from the hands of our enemies,
Free to worship him without fear: holy and righteous
in his sight all the days of our life.
You my child shall be called the prophet of the Most High:
for you will go before the Lord to prepare his way,
to give his people knowledge of salvation
by the forgiveness of all their sins.
In the tender compassion of our God:
the dawn from on high shall break upon us,
to shine on those who dwell in darkness and the shadow of death:
and to guide our feet into the way of peace.
Glory to the Father, Son and the Holy Spirit; as it was in the beginning, is now and ever shall be. Amen.

item.title: Song of Paul
item.stanza: You are the image of the invisible God,
the first born over all creation.
By you, O Christ, were all things created.
in heaven and on earth, visible and invisible
Thrones and dominions, powers and principalities:
were created through you and for you.
You are before everything and
in you all things hold together.
You are the head of your body, the Church
you are the beginning, the first born from the dead,
that over everything you may be supreme.
Glory to the Father, to the Son and to the Holy Spirit; as it was in the beginning, is now and ever shall be. Amen.

section.title: Second Reading from the New Testament
section.rubric: At the end of the reading the reader says:
section.item: This is the word of the Lord.
Thanks be to God.

section.title: The Song of Jesus, Song of the Church or the Song of Revelation

item.title: Song of Jesus
item.stanza: Love your enemies:
do good to those who hate you,
bless those who curse you:
pray for those who ill-treat you.
For I was hungry and you gave me something to eat:
I was thirsty and you gave me something to drink.
I was a stranger and you invited me in:
I needed clothes and you clothed me.
I was sick and you looked after me:
I was in prison and you came to visit me.
The blind receive sight:
the lame walk, lepers are cured.
The deaf hear, the dead are raised:
the good news is preached to the poor,
and blessed are those not offended at me.
Glory to the Father, the Lord of heaven and earth:
Glory to the Son, to whom all things are given.
Glory to the Spirit, in whom the Son rejoices,
Now and for ever. Amen.

item.title: Te Deum Laudamus (Song of the Church)
item.stanza: You are God and we praise you:
you are the Lord and we acclaim you.
You are the eternal Father:
creation worships you.
To you all angels, all the powers of heaven:
Cherubim and seraphim sing in endless praise,
Holy, holy, holy Lord, God of power and might:
heaven and earth are full of your glory.
The glorious company of apostles praise you:
the noble fellowship of prophets praise you
the white-robed army of martyrs praise you.
Throughout the world the holy Church acclaims you:
Father of majesty unbounded;
your true and only Son worthy of all worship:
and the Holy Spirit advocate and guide.
You Christ are the King of glory:
the eternal Son of the Father.
When you became man to set us free:
you did not abhor the Virgin's womb.
You overcame the sting of death:
and opened the kingdom of heaven to all believers.
You are seated at God's right hand in glory.
We believe that you will come and be our judge.
Come then Lord and help your people;
bought with the price of your own blood;
and bring us with your saints:
to glory everlasting.
Save your people Lord and bless your inheritance:
govern and uphold them now and always.
15 Day by day we bless you:
we praise your name for ever.
Keep us today Lord from all sin:
have mercy on us Lord, have mercy.
17 Lord show us your love and mercy:
for we put our trust in you.
In you Lord is our hope:
let us not be confounded at the last.

item.title: Song of Revelation
item.stanza: Alleluia! For the Lord our God the Almighty reigns:
Let us rejoice and be glad and give him the glory.
Worthy is the Lord our God:
for he created everything.
Worthy is the Lamb who was slain:
for by his blood he ransomed us for God from every tribe and tongue, people and nation.
Great and wonderful are your deeds, Lord God the Almighty:
just and true are your ways, O king of ages!
Who shall not fear and praise your name O Lord?
For you alone are holy.
nations shall come and worship in your presence:
for your just deeds have been revealed.
To him who sits on the throne and to the lamb
be blessing and honour, glory and might,
for ever and ever. Amen.

section.title: Notes
section.item: Where the rubric specifies that the congregation should kneal is understood that sitting is also allowed.
Hymns, choruses and choir items may be inserted as deemed appropriate.
Sufficient bread and wine should be placed on the Holy Tab that reconsecration is not necessary. Whatever has been consumed should all be consumed.
The Praver of Thanksgiving (Section 27) is a single prayer. It is recommended that the congregation stands throughout this prayer to emphasize its unity.
Special seasonal thanksgiving to be included in the Prayer of Thanksgiving (Section 27) are written in the appendix
Extemporary prayers are also encouraged.
The breaking of bread is in Section 29.

section.rubric: At the entry the people stand and a hymn is announced.
The minister reads a scriptural sentence.
section.item: God rained down upon them manna to eat, and gave them the grain of heaven.Psalm 78:24

You shall have a song as in the night when a holy feast is kept; and gladness of heart, as when one sets out to the sound of the pipe to go to the mountain of the Lord, to the Rock of Israel. Isaiah.30:29
Why spend money and get what is not bread, why give the price of your labour and go unsatisfied? Listen to me and you will have good food to eat. Isaiah 55:2
Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life; he who comes to me shall not hunger, and he who believes in me shall never thirst", John 6:35
Christ our paschal lamb has been sacrificed. Let us therefore celebrate the festival, not with the old leaven of malice and ev but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth. 1 Corinthians 5:8

Our ancestors all ate the same supernatural food and all drank the same supernatural drink, for they drank from the same supernatural Rock which followed them, and the Rock was Christ. I Corinthians 10:3-4
Christmas
She will bear a son and you shall call his name Jesus, for he will save his people from their sins. Matthew 1:21
Easter
When he was at table with them, he took the bread and blessed it, broke it, and gave it to them. And their eyes were opened and they recognized him. Luke 24:30
Pentecost
For by one Spirit we were all baptised into one body-Jew or Greek, slave or free and all were made to drink of one Spirit. I Corinthians 12:13

section.rubric: The minister welcomes the people using these or other appropriate words.
section.item: The Lord be with you.
And also with you.
The earth is the Lord's and all that is in it:
Let the heavens rejoice and the earth be glad.
Our help is in the name of the Lord:
Who made heaven and earth.
I was glad when they said to me:
Let us go to the house of the Lord.”
Praise the Lord:
The name of the Lord be praised.

section.rubric: The following acclamations should be added according to the season.
section.item: Christmas
The Prince of Peace is born:
O come let us adore him!
Easter
Christ is risen:
He is risen indeed! Alleluia!
Pentecost
The Spirit is here: People The promise of God.
Let us pray.

section.rubric: People kneel. One of the following prayers for purity is said by all.

item.stanza: Almighty God,
You bring to light
Things hidden in darkness,
And know the shadows of our hearts;
Cleanse and renew us by your Spirit,
That we may walk in the light
And glorify your name,
Through Jesus Christ,
The Light of the world. Amen.

section.item: Or

item.stanza: Almighty God,
To whom all hearts are open,
desires known,
and from whom no secrets are hidden:
cleanse the thoughts of our hearts
by the inspiration of your Holy Spirit,
that we may perfectly love you,
and worthily magnify your holy name;
through Christ our Lord. Amen.

section.item: remain kneeling. Then follows the reading of either the Ten Commandments, or the New Testament interpretation of the Law, or the Summary of the Law.

Almighty God, whose steadfast love is as great as the heavens are high above the earth, remove your sins from you as far as the east is from the west, strenghten your life in his kingdom and keep you upright to last day, through Jesus Christ our merciful High Priest.
Amen.

Thank you Father, for forgiveness; We come to vour table as your children, not presuming but assured, not trusting ourselves but your Word; we hunger and thirst for righteousness, and ask for our hearts to be satisfied with the body and blood of your Son, Jesus Christ the righteous.Amen.

section.title: Sharing of Peace
section.rubric: The people stand.
section.item: The peace of the Lord be always with you.
And also with you.
Let us offer one another a sign of peace.
The people greet each other with a handshake or other appropriate gestures.

section.rubric: The Holy Table is prepared for communion. A hymn is sung, during which the offering is collected. The presiding minister and his assistants may wash hands. If there is no offering the minister moves directly to section 27. When there is an offering, the minister and people may respond in the following or other appropriate manner.
section.item: All things come from you Lord.
And of your own have we given you.

section.title: Prayer of Thanksgiving
section.rubric: The people remain standing
section.item: We remain standing for thanksgiving and remembrance.
Is the Father with us?
He is.
Is Christ among us?
He is.
Is the Spirit here?
He is.
This is our God.
Father, Son and the Holy Spirit.
We are his people.
We are redeemed.
Lift up your hearts.
We lift them to the Lord.
Let us give thanks to the Lord our God.
It is right to give him thanks and praise.

It is right and our delight to give you thanks and praise great Father, living God, supreme over the world. Creator, Provider, Saviour and Giver. From a wandering nomad you created your family. for a burdened people you raised up a leader; for a confused nation you chose a king; for a rebellious crowd you sent your prophets. In these last days you have sent us your Son, your perfect image, bringing your kingdom, revealing your will, dying, rising, reigning remaking your people for yourself. Through him you have poured out your Holy Spirit, filling us with light and life.

section.rubric: Special thanksgiving shall be said at this point when appropriate (See Appendix Page 86)
section.item: Advent Either
And now we give you thanks and praise because he came as man when the day of our deliverance had dawned, and will come again in power and triumph to judge the world and to consummate all things.
Or
And now we give you thanks because you prepared the way of your Son by the preaching of your prophet John the Baptist, who proclaimed him as the Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world.
Christmas Either

And now we give you thanks because you gave your only Son to be born at this time for us, who through the power of the Holy Spirit was made man, being born of the Virgin Mary: in him there was neither spot nor sin, and in him we are cleansed from all sin.
Or

And now we give you thanks because in the Incarnation of the Eternal Word, a new light has dawned upon the world, and those who sat in darkness and under the shadow of death have seen the great light.
Easter Day
EITHER

And now we praise you for the glorious resurrection of your Son, the lamb who was offered for us and has taken away the sin of the world: by his death he has destroyed death, and by his rising to new life he has restored to us eternal life.
Or

And now we give you thanks because you raised him gloriously from the dead: through him you have given us the resurrection hope, for our life will be changed, not taken away; when our mortal flesh is laid aside, we will enter our everlasting dwelling place to live with him.
Ascension Day
EITHER

And now we give you thanks because you have highly exalted your Son, and have given him the name above every name, that at the name of Jesus every knee shall bow, and every tongue confess that Jesus Christ is Lord.
OR
And now we give you thanks because, after his resurrection, your dearly beloved Son ascended into heaven, where he now prepares a place for us and will receive us in his eternal glory.
Pentecost
Either

And now we give you thanks because the coming of the Holy Spirit upon the Apostles inspired them to speak in tongues and gave them courage to preach the Gospel to all nations: by their preaching we have come to a true knowledge of you.
Or

And now we give you thanks because your Holy Spirit inspired the scriptures and leads us into all truth: he gives us power to proclaim your gospel to all nations and to serve you as a royal priesthood.
Trinity Sunday

And now we give you thanks because you have revealed to us your glory as the glory of your Son and of the Holy Spirit: three Persons, equal in majesty, undivided in splendour, yet One Lord, One God, ever to be trusted and adored.
All Saints' Day

And now we give you thanks for the hope to which you call us in your Son, that following in faith of all your saints, we may run with perseverance the race that is set before us, looking to Jesus the Pioneer and Perfecter of our faith.
Benediction of a Church
And now we give you thanks for this house of prayer, dedicated to your glory, where your people, the true temple of the Holy Spirit, gather together in worship.
Ordination, Consecration or Enthronement

And now we give you thanks because within the royal priesthood of your Church you ordain pastors and consecrate bishops, to tend and guide your flock, to proclaim the good news of salvation and to celebrate the sacraments of the New Covenant.
Therefore with angels, archangels, faithful ancestors and all in heaven, we proclaim your great and glorious name, forever praising you and saying:

item.stanza: Holy, holy, holy Lord,
God of power and might,
Heaven and earth are full of your glory.
Hosanna in the highest.

section.item: THE BREAKING OF BREAD IS AT SECTION 29.
The presiding minister performs the traditional actions of taking the bread and the cup.
The people remain standing.

Almighty God, owner of all things, we thank you for giving up your Son to die on the cross for us who owe you everything, Pour your refreshing Spirit on us as we remember him in the way he commanded, through these gifts of your creation. On the same night that he was betrayed he took bread and gave thanks; broke it and gave it to his disciples, saying, 'Take, eat, this is my body which is given for you; Do this in remembrance of me'.
Amen. His body was broken for us.

In the same way, after supper he took the cup and gave you thanks; he gave it to them saying: Drink this, all of you, this is my blood of the new covenant, which is shed for you and for many, for the forgiveness of sins. Do this as often as you drink it, in remembrance of me.
Christ has died
Christ is risen
Christ will come again.
We are brothers and sisters through his blood.
We have died together,
we will rise together,
we will live together.

Therefore, heavenly Father, hear us as we celebrate this covenant with joy, and await the coming of our Saviour, Jesus Christ. He died in our place, making a full atonement for the sins of the whole world, the perfect sacrifice, once and for all. You accepted his offering by raising him from death, and granting him great honour at your right hand on high.
Amen. Jesus is Lord.
This is the feast of victory
The lamb who was slain has begun his reign. Alleluia.

section.title: Introductory Sentences
section.rubric: One or more of these sentences may be said after the introduction.
section.item: Let us enter his gates with thanksgiving.
Worship him in the splendor of his holiness.

section.title: Order of Service
section.rubric: At the entry of the procession the people stand. A hymn is sung after which the people remain standing and the leader welcomes them with the following words.
section.item: The Lord be with you.
And also with you.
We are heirs of the Father.
joint heirs with the son,
renewed in the spirit,
together we are one.

If we say that we have no sin we deceive ourselves and the truth is not in us. If we confess our sins, in repentance and trust, God is faithful and just, and will forgive us our sins. So let us confess them to our Father.

Eternal Father, God of our ancestors, before your power all things tremble, but through your son, we approach your throne. We have done wrong and neglected to do right; our sins weigh heavily on our hearts: Lord have mercy, count them not against us. Grant us the joy of forgiveness and lighten our hearts with the glory of Christ, who died and rose again for us. Amen.

The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ rejoices at repentance and declares his acceptance. The dead are alive, the lost are found. His goodness and mercy will follow you all the days of your life, and you will live in the house of the Lord for ever.

section.rubric: When a minister is not present the lay leader is to use the following prayer.
section.item: Lord of mercy, grant us your pardon and peace; that cleansed from our sins and with peace in our hearts, we may be free to serve you; through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.

section.title: Maelezo
section.item: Zaburi za siku ziimbwe au zisomwe kwa majibizano.
Wimbo au nyimbo zinaweza kuimbwa au kusomwa kwa majibizano.
Sala mbadala ya kutangaza msamaha pamoja na ile ya haraka za mwisho wakati mchungaji hayupo zimewekwa ili kutumiwa na kiongozi mlei.

Sadaka: Katika ibada hii na zile nyinginezo. inahimizwa kwamba kiongozi wa ibada awahimize wakristo watoe kwa ukarimu kwa kazi ya Mungu, kwa kusoma na kufafanua vifungu vya maandiko vinavyoambatana na utoaji na uwakili.

section.rubric: Watu wanasimama msafara unapoingia. Wimbo unaimbwa ukimalizika, hali watu wamesimama, kiongozi awakaribishe kwa ibada kisha ufuate utangulizi wa ibada kwa maneno yafuatayo:
section.item: Bwana Yesu akae nanyi
Akae nawe pia.

Tumekusanyika hapa kwa nguvu za Roho Mtakatifu, tulisifu jina takatifu la Bwana Yesu na kusikia neno lake. Tumekuja tushirikiane habari njema za utukufu na neema zake. Pia kuombea mahitaji yetu na ya wanaoteseka kote duniani, kadhalika tufurahi katika pendo na amani yake.
Tuwarithi wa Baraka za Mungu.
Warithi pamoja na Mwana wa Mungu.
Tunafanywa upya kwa njia ya Roho wa Mungu
Sote tu wamoja katika Kristo.

section.title: Aya za Biblia
section.rubric: Aya moja au zaidi katika hizi zifuatazo zisomwe baada ya utangulizi.
section.item: Ezekieli 18:27 Mtu muovu akiachana na uovu aliofanya, akatenda mambo yaliyo haki na sawa, huyo atayaokoa maisha yake.
Yoeli 2:13 Msirarue mavazi yenu kuonesha huzuni, bali mrudieni Bwana kwa moyo wa toba. Mrudieni Mwenyezi Mungu, Mungu wenu.
Zaburi 37:4 Yeye amejaa neema na huruma; hakasiriki upesi, ni mwingi wa fadhili daima yu tayari kuacha kuadhibu. Uitafute furaha yako kwa Mwenyezi Mungu, naye atakujalia unayo amani moyoni.
Zaburi 36:9 Wewe ndiwe asili ya uhai; kwa mwanga wako twaona mwanga.
Zaburi 84:2 Nafsi yangu yatamani rnno maskani ya mwenyezi Mungu! Moyo na mwili wangu wote wamshangilia Mungu aliye hai.
Zaburi 63:1 Ee Mungu, wewe U Mungu wangu, nami nakutafuta kwa moyo roho yangu inakutamani kama mtu mwenye kiu.
Zaburi 73:25 Mbinguni, nani awezaye kunisaidia ila wewe? Na duniani hamna ninachotamani ila wewe!
Isaya 1;16-17 Jiosheni, jitakaseni; ondoeni uovu wa matendo yenu mbele yangu. Acheni kutenda maovu, jifunzeni kutenda mema.
Isaya 2:3 Nioni tupande mlima wa Mwenyezi Mungu-apate kutufundisha njia zake, nasi tuishi kadiri ya mwongozo wake.
Isaya 65:24 Hata kabla hawajaniita, mimi nitawaitikia, kabla hawaiamaliza kusema, nitakuwa nimewajibu.
Isaya 66:2 Ninachojali mimi ni mtu mnyenyekevu na mwenye majuto, mtu anayetetemeka asikiapo neno langu.
Mika 6:8 Anachotaka Mwenyezi Mungu kwako ni hiki: kutenda mambo ya haki, kupenda, kuwa na huruma, na kuishi kwa unyenyekevu na Mungu wako.
Mathayo 5:17 Msidhani kuwa nimekuja kutangua sheria na mafundisho ya manabii. Sikuja kutangua bali kukamilisha.

Luka 6:20-22 "Heri nyinyi mlio maskini, maana ufalme wa Mungu ni wenu. “Heri nyinyi mnaosikia njaa sasa, maana baadaye mtashiba. “Heri nyinyi mnaolia sasa, maana baadaye mtacheka kwa furaha. "Heri yenu nyinyi iwapo watu watawachukia-maana hakika tuzo lenu ni kubwa mbinguni.
Luka 12:32 “Msiogope, enyi kundi dogo! Maana Baba yenu amependa kuwapeni ufalme.
Luka 15:7 "Nawaambieni, ndivyo kutakavyokuwa na furaha Mbinguni kwa ajili ya kutubu kwa Mwenye dhambi mmoja kuliko kwa ajili ya watu tisini na tisa wanaojiona kuwa wema, wasiohitaji kutubu.
Luka 15:18-19 "Nitarudi kwa baba yangu na kumwambia: Baba, nimemkosa Mungu, na nimekukosea wewe pia. Sistahili hata kuitwa mwanao,”

section.title: Kiogozi wa Ibada
section.item: Tukisema kwamba hatuna dhambi, tunajidanganya wenyewe, na ukweli haumo ndani yetu. Lakini tukiziungama dhambi zetu kwa toba na tumaini, Mungu ni mwaminifu na wa haki naye atatusamehe dhambi zetu na kututakasa uovu wote. Kwa hiyo na tuungame mbele za Baba yetu wa mbinguni.
Watu wapige mogoti

Baba uishiye milele, Mungu wa wazazi wetu wa kale, mbele zako vitu vyote vinatetemeka, bali kupitia kwa mwanao, twakaribia kiti chako cha enzi. Tumeasi na kukataa kutenda mema; Mioyo yetu imelemewa na dhambi: Turehemu ee Bwana, usituhesabie makosa yetu. Tujalie furaha ya msamaha, na utuangazie mioyoni mwetu utukufu wa Yeye aliyekufa na kufufuka kwa ajili yetu, Yesu Kristo Bwana wetu. Amin.

Mwenyezi Mungu, Baba wa Bwana wetu Yesu Kristo, ambaye hupendezwa na kuridhia toba; wafu huwa hai na waliopotea humrudia Bwana. Wema na fadhili za Bwana zitawafuata siku zote za maisha yenu, nanyi mtakaa nyumbani wa Bwana milele.
Amin.

section.rubric: Wakati kasisi hayupo, kiongozi mlei atatumia sala ifutayo.
section.item: Bwana mwenye rehema, utujalie msamaha wa dhambi zetu na amani, tuwe huru kukutumikia, kwa Yesu Kristo Bwana wetu.
Amin.
Wamebarikiwa wakaao nyumbani mwako ee Bwana;
TWataziimba sifa zako siku zote.
Bwana Yesu Asifiwe.
Jina la Bwana litukuzwe.

section.rubric: Watu wasimame.
section.item: Utukufu uwe kwa Baba aliye asili ya vitu vyote.
Utukufu kwa Mwana aliyefanyika mwanadamu. Utukufu kwa Roho Mtakatifu mwenye kutuhuisha, Bwana Mungu wetu milele! Aleluya!

section.rubric: Kati ya Jumapili za Krismasi na Udhihirisho, na kati ya Jumapili ya Pasaka na Pentekoste aina ifuatayo ya utukufu itumike badala ya hiyo hapo juu.
section.item: Mtukufu mwana wa Mungu aliye juu
Amezaliwa kwa ajili yetu, kupitia kwa tumbo la Mariamu.
Mfalme wa amani asiye na makao duniani
na kulazwa kaburini mwa Yusufu.
Bwana mtawala wa uzima na mauti
Avunja minyororo ya uovu na maangamizi.

section.title: Wimbo wa Furaha (Jubilate), Wimba wa Ushindi (Venite) au Wimbo wa Habakuki

item.title: Wimbo wa Furaha (Jubilate)
item.stanza: Nitapita milango ya hekalu lake kwa shukrani
Naingia nyuani mwake kwa kusifu.
Nitasema hii ndiyo siku Bwana aliyoifanya.
Nitafurahi kwa kuwa amenipa furaha.
Amenifurahisha, Amenifurahisha:
Nitashangilia kwa kuwa amenipa furaha.
Amenifurahisha, Amenifurahisha:
aNitashangilia kwa kuwa amenipa furaha.

item.title: Wimba wa Ushindi (Venite)
item.stanza: Njoni tumwimbie Mwenyezi Mungu:
tumshangilie mwamba wa wokovu wetu!
Twende mbele yake na shukrani:
tumshangilie kwa nyimbo za sifa.
Maana Mwenyezi Mungu, ni Mungu mkuu:
yeye ni Mfalme mkuu juu ya miungu yote.
Vilindi vyote vya dunia vimo mikononi mwake:
vilele vya milima ni vyake.
Bahari ni yake, ndiye aliyeifanya:
kwa mikono yake aliiumba nchi kavu.
Njoni tusujudu na kumwabudu:
tumpigie magoti Mwenyezi Mungu, Muumba wetu!
Maana yeye ni Mungu wetu:
nasi ni watu wa kundi lake, ni kondoo wake anaowachunga.
Laiti leo mngesikiliza sauti yake:
na yuaja kuhukumu dunia.
Msiwe wakaidi kama kule Meriba:
kama walivyokuwa kule Masa jangwani.
Wazee wenu waliponijariu na kunipima:
Ingawa walikuwa wameona mambo niliyowatendea
Kwa miaka arubaini nilichukizwa nao, nikasema:
'Kweli, hawa ni watu waliopotoka.
Hawajali kabisa njia zangu!'
Basi, nilikasirika, nikaapa:
‘Hawataingia mahali pangu pa pumziko!'
Utukufu una Baba, Mwana, na Roho Mtakatifu; Ulivyokuwa mwanzo, ulivyo sasa hata milele ni vivyo. Amin.

item.title: Wimbo wa Habakuki
item.stanza: Hata kama Mwembe usipochanua maua,
wala mzabibu kuzaa matunda.
Hata kama mazao ya minazi hayatakuwepo,
na mashamba yasipotoa chakula,
Hata kama kondoo wakitoweka kundini,
na mifugo isiwemo zizini,
Mimi nitaendelea kumfurahia Mwenyezi Mungu,
nitamshangilia Mungu wa wokovu wangu.
Utukufu una Baba, Mwana, na Roho Mtakatifu; Ulivyokuwa mwanzo, ulivyo sasa hata milele ni vivyo. Amin.

section.title: Zaburi Ya Siku
section.rubric: Inaweza kuimbwa au kusemwa kwa majibizano, na imalizikapo yaimbwe au yasemwe maneno haya:
section.item: Utukufu una Baba, Mwana, na Roho Mtakatifu; Ulivyokuwa mwanzo, ulivyo sasa hata milele ni vivyo. Amin.

section.title: Somo la Kwanza (Kutoka Agano la Kale.)
section.rubric: Mwanzo wa somo msomaji aseme:
section.item: Somo la kwanza lapatikana katika kitabu cha/waraka wa ...sura ya ... kuanzia mstari wa ...
Mwisho wa somo msomaji aseme:
Hili ndilo neno la Bwana.
Tumshukuru Mungu.

section.title: Wimbo wa Masihi, Wimbo wa Zakaria au Wimbo wa Paulo

item.title: Wimbo wa Masihi
item.stanza: Yesu uzao wa Ibrahimu abariki mataifa:
Yesu nabii mfano wa Musa anaweka huru wanaogandamizwa:
Yesu, Bwana wa mfalme Daudi huongoza watu wake:
Yesu, Mtumishi wa Mungu anavumilia na kuokoa:
Yesu Mwana wa Adamu aliuwawa na kufufuka.
Utukufu una Baba, Mwana na Roho Mtakatifu; Ulivyokuwa mwanzo, ulivyo sasa hata milele ni vivyo. Amin.

item.title: Wimbo wa Zakaria (Benedictus)
item.stanza: Atukuzwe Bwana Mungu wa Israeli:
kwani amewajia na kuwakomboa watu wake.
Ametupatia Mwokozi shujaa:
mzawa wa Daudi mtumishi wake.
Aliahidi hapo kale kwa njia ya manabii
wake watakatifu: kwamba atatuokoa mikononi
mwa adui zetu, na kutoka mikononi mwa wote wanaotuchukia.
Alisema atawahurumia wazee wetu,
a kukumbuka agano lake takatifu
Alimwaapia Abrahamu babu yetu;
kwamba atatujalia sisi, tukombolewe mikononi mwa adui zetu,
Tupate kumtumikia bila hofu:
tuwe wanyofu na waadilifu mbele yake,
siku zote za maisha yetu.
Nawe mwanangu, utaitwa, nabii wa Mungu Mkuu:
tamtangulia Bwana kumtayarishia njia yake;
Kuwatangazia watu kwamba wataokolewa
kwa kuondolewa dhambi zao.
Mungu wetu ni mpole na mwenye huruma,
Atatuchomozea mwanga kutoka juu, na
kuwaangazia wote wanaokaa katika giza kuu la
kifo, aongoze hatua zetu katika njia ya amani.
Utukufu una Baba, Mwana na Roho Mtakatifu; Ulivyokuwa mwanzo, ulivyo sasa, hata milele ni vivyo. Amin.

item.title: Wimbo wa Paulo
item.stanza: Kristo ni mfano wa Mungu asiyeonekana,
ni mzaliwa wa kwanza wa viumbe vyote.
Maana kwake vitu vyote viliumbwa kila kitu
duniani na mbinguni, vinavyoonekana na visivyoonekana:
Wenye enzi, watawala, wakuu na wenye nguvu;
vyote viliumbwa kwake na kwa ajili yake.
Yeye alikuwako kabla ya vitu vyote;
vyote hudumu mahali pake kwa uwezo wake.
Yeye ni kichwa cha mwili wake, yaani kanisa;
Yeye ni chanzo cha uhai wa huo mwili:
Yeye ndiye mwanza, mzaliwa wa kwanza
Aliyefufuliwa kutoka wafu, ili awe na nafasi
Ya kwanza katika vitu vyote.
Utukufu una Baba, Mwana na Roho Mtakatifu; Ulivyokuwa mwanzo, ulivyo sasa, hata milele ni vivyo. Amin.

section.title: Somo la Pili (Autoka Agano Jipya)
section.rubric: Mwanzo wa somo msomaji aseme:
section.item: Somo la pili lapatikana katika kitabu cha/waraka wa ...sura ya ... kuanzia mstari wa ...
Mwisho wa somo msomaji aseme:
Hili ndilo neno la Bwana.
Tumshukuru Mungu.

section.title: Wimbo wa Yesu, Wimbo wa Kanisa au Wimbo wa Ufunuo

item.title: Wimbo wa Yesu
item.stanza: Wapendeni adui zenu:
Watendeeni mema wale wanaowachukieni.
Watakieni Baraka wale wanaowalaani:
Na waombeeni wale wanawatendea vibaya.
Maana nilikuwa na njaa nanyi mkanipa chakula:
nilikuwa na kiu nanyi mkanipa maji.
Nilikuwa mgeni nanyi mkanikaribisha:
Nilikuwa uchi mkanivika.
Nilikuwa mgonjwa nanyi mkaja kunitazama:
Nilikuwa gerezani nanyi mkaja Kunitembelea.
Vipofu wanaona: viwete wanatembea.
wenye ukoma wanatakaswa
Viziwi wanasikia, wafu wanafufuliwa:
na maskini wanahubiriwa habari njema.
Heri mtu yule ambaye hana mashaka nami.
Utukufu kwa Baba, Bwana wa Mbingu na dunia:
Utukufu kwa Mwana ambaye kwake Yeye vitu vyote vimetiishwa.
Utukufu kwa Roho ambaye Mwana humfurahia,
sasa hata milele. Amin.

item.title: Wimbo wa Kanisa (Te Deum Laudamus)
item.stanza: EE MUNGU, twakusifu:
twakukiri wewe ndiwe Bwana.
Ulimwengu wote wakuabudu:
Ee Baba wa milele.
Malaika wote wakupazia sauti:
nazo mbingu na nguvu zote zilizomo.
Makerubi na Maserafi:
wakuimbia daima.
Mtakatifu, Mtakatifu, Mtakatifu:
Bwana Mungu wa majeshi.
Mbingu na nchi zimejaa:
enzi ya utukufu wako.
Jamii tukufu ya Mitume yakuhimidi:
umati utukufu wa Manabii wakuhimidi.
Jeshi tukufu la Mashahidi lakuhimidi:
Kanisa takatifu lakukiri kote Baba mwenye enzi kuu.
Tena Mwana wako pekee:
wa kweli, wa kuabudiwa.
Na Roho Mtakatifu:
aletaye msaada.
Ee Kristo ndiwe mfalme wa utukufu:
Lindiwe Mwana wa milele wa Baba.
Ulipojitwika mzigo wa kuokoa binadamu:
hukuchukizwa na tumbo la Bikira.
Ulipoushinda uchungu wa mauti:
uliwafunulia waaminio ufalme wa mbinguni.
Umekaa mkono wa kuume wa Mungu:
katika utukufu wake Baba.
Twaamini kwamba utakuja:
kuwa Mhukumu wetu.
Kwa hiyo, twakuomba, uwasadie watumishi wako:
uliowakomboa kwa damu yako ya thamani.
Wahesabiwe pamoja na watakatifu wako:
katika utukufu wa milele.
Uwaokoe watu wako, Bwana, uubariki urithi wako:
uwamiliki, uwainue hata makao ya milele.
Twakutukuza kila siku:
twalisifu Jina lako sasa hata milele.
Uwe radhi, Bwana kutulinda leo tusitende dhambi:
uturehemu Ee Bwana, uturehemu.
Utuonee huruma, Ee Bwana:
kwa vile tulivyokutumaini Wewe.
Nimekutumaini Wewe Bwana:
nisiaibike milele.

item.title: Wimbo wa Ufunuo
item.stanza: Asifiwe Mungu! Maana Bwana Mungu wetu Mwenye Nguvu ametawala:
Tufurahi na kushangilia; na tumtukuze.
Anastahili Bwana Mungu wetu maana:
Wewe uliumba vitu vyote.
Anastahili mwana kondoo aliyeuawa:
Ambaye kwa damu yake ametukomboa, ili tumrudie Mungu kutoka kila kabila, lugha, jamii na taifa,
Matendo yako ni makuu na ya ajabu Ee Bwana, Mungu Mwenyezi:
Njia zako ni za haki na kweli!
Ewe mfalme wa milele.
wana ni nani asiyekucha wewe;
Nani asiyelitukuza jina lako?
Wewe peke yako ni Mtakatifu.
Mataifa yote yatakujia na kukuabudu:
Maana matendo yako ya haki yamedhihirishwa.
wake Yeye aketiye katika kiti cha enzi, na kwa mwana kondoo,
Iwe sifa na heshima na utukufu na enzi,
milele na milele, Amin

section.title: Maelezo
section.item: Watu wanapoambiwa wapige magoti, ieleweke kwamba wanaweza kuketi iwapo hawawezi kupiga magoti,
Nafasi za nyimbo, pambio na kwaya zawcza kuwekwa kama iiakavyofaa.
Ni vyema kuwepo mkate na divai ya kutosha ili kusiwe na haja ya kuvibariki mara kadhaa. Kadhalika, vile vilvyowekwa wakfu pia sharti vimalizwe.
Sala ya shukrani (sehemu ya 27) ni sala moja. Inapendekezwa kwamba watu wasimame isemwapo ili kuupa mkazo huo umoja.
Maombi maalum ya shukrani za kulingana na nyakati ambazo huingizwa katika ibada ya shukrani, (sehemu ya 27) yamewekwa katika faharasa. Watu tofauti wahi mizwe kuongoza maombi ya kutoka moyoni mwao.
“Kuumega mkate" inapatikana sehemu ya 29.

section.rubric: Kasisi anapoingia, watu wasimame.
Kisha asome aya ya Biblia.
section.item: Mojawapo va aya hizi au nyingine zifaazo, zisemwe na kasisi katika sehemu yo 2. Mungu akawanyeshea Mana wale, akawapa nafaka kutoka mbinguni.Zaburi 78:24

Lakini nyinyi watu wa Yerusalemu mtaimba kwa furaha kama mfanyavyo wakati wa mkesha wa sikukuu. Mtajaa furaha kama watu wanaotembea kwa mdundo wa muziki wa filimbi kwenda mlimani kwa Mwenyezi Mungu, Mwamba wa Israeli,Isaya 30:29

Mbona mnatumia fedha yenu kwa ajili ya kitu kisicho cha kula? Ya nini kutoa jasho lenu kwa kitu kisichoshibisha? Nisikilizeni mimi kwa makini, nanyi mtakula vilivyo bora, na kufurahia vinono.Isaya 55:2
Yesu akawaambia, 'Mimi ndimi mkate wa uhai. Anayekuja kwangu hataona njaa; anayeniamini hataona kiu kamwe."Yohana 6:35
Pasaka yetu, amekwisha tolewa kuwa sadaka. Basi, tufanye karamu hiyo si kwa chachu ile ya kale, chachu ya ubaya na uovu, bali kwa mkate usiotiwa chachu, mkate wa usafi na kweli.I Wakorintho 5:8
Wote walikula chakula kile-kile cha kiroho, wakanywa pia kinywaji kilekile cha kiroho, maana walikunywa kutoka ule mwamba wa kiroho uliowafuata; Mwamba huo ulikuwa Kristo mwenyewe.I Wakorintho 10:3-4
Lrismasi
Atajifungua mtoto wa kiume, nawe utampa jina Yesu, kwa kuwa yeye ndiye atakayewaokoa watu wake katika dhambi zao.Mathayo 1:21
Easter
Alipoketi kula chakula pamoja nao, akachukua mkate, akaubariki, akaumega, akawapa. Mara macho yao yakafunguliwa, wakamtambua.Luka 24:30
Pentekoste
Maana sisi, tukiwa Wayahudi au watu wa mataifa mengine, watumwa au watu huru, sote tumebatizwa kwa Roho mmoja katika mwili huo mmoja; na sote tukanyweshwa Roho huyo mmoja.I Wakorintho 12:13

section.rubric: Hatimaye awakaribishe watu akitumia maneno yafuatayo au mengine yanayofaa:
section.item: Bwana Yesu akae nanyi:
Akae nawe pia
TDunia na vyote vilivyomo ni mali ya Bwana:
Mbingu nazishangilie na dunia ifurahi.
Msaada wetu u katika jina la Bwana
Aliyeziumba mbingu na nchi.
Nilifurahi waliponiambia
"Twendeni nyumbani kwa Baba."
Msifuni Bwana Yesu:
Jina la Bwana litukuzwe.

section.rubric: Matamko yafuatayo yaongezewe sala hii kulingana na nyakati zake.
section.item: Krismasi
Mfalme wa Amani amezaliwa:
Njooni tumuabudu.
Pasaka
Kristo amefufuka
Amefufuka kweli kweli! Aleluya!
Pentekoste
Roho wa Bwana yuko hapa:
Amefufuka kweli kweli! Aleluya!
Na tuombe.

section.rubric: Watu wapige magoti. Mojawapo ya sala zifuatazo za utakaso isemwe na wote.

item.stanza: Wote Mwenyezi Mungu,
ufichuaye mambo
yaliyositirika gizani,
unayezijua siri za mioyo yetu.
Ututakase na kutuhuisha kwa Roho wako,
ili tuenende katika mwanga
na kulitukuza jina lako,
kwa Yesu Kristo
aliye nuru ya ulimwengu. Amin.

section.item: Au

item.stanza: Wote Mwenyezi Mungu,
ambaye kwako wewe mioyo yote iwazi,
haja zetu umezijua,
wala hakuna la siri lililofichika kwako:
Uyasafishe mawazo ya mioyo yetu
kwa uvuvio wa Roho wako Mtakatifu,
ili tukupendeze kwa ukamilifu;
na kulitukuza jina lako kama itupasavyo,
kwa Kristo Bwana wetu. Amin.

section.title: Sheria za Mungu (Amri Kumi)
section.rubric: Watu waendelee kupiga magoti kisha kasisi asome Amri kumi, au ufupisho wake kama ilivyo katika Agano jipya. Kasisi Sikieni amri za Mungu, na mjitahidi kuzitekeleza.
section.item: Sikieni amri za Mungu, na mjitahidi kuzitekeleza.
Mimi ndimi Mwenyezi Mungu, Mungu wako, niliyekutoa nchini Misri, ambako ulikuwa mitumwa. Usiwe na miungu mingine ila mimi
Amin, Bwana, uturehemu, utujalie neema tuweze kuitii amri hii.

Usijifanyie sanamu ya miungu wa uongo, au kinyago cha kitu chochote kilicho mbinguni, katika nchi, au majini chini ya dunia. Usiisujudie wala kuitumikia; kwa kuwaa mimi Mwenyezi-Mungu, Mungu wako, ni Mungu mwenye wivu
Amin, Bwana, uturehemu, utujalie neema tuweze kuitii amri hii.
Usilitaje bure jina langu mimi Mwenyezi Mungu, Mungu wako. Maana mimi Mwenyezi Mungu sitaacha kumwadhibu anayetumiajina langu vibaya.
Amin, Bwana, uturehemu, utujalie neema tuweze kuitii amri hii.

Usisahau kuiweka takatifu siku ya Sabato. Siku sita fanya kazi na tenda mambo yako yote. Lakini siku ya saba ni Sabato ya Mwenyezi Mungu, Mungu wako.Siku hiyo usifanye kazi yoyote, wewe, wala mwanao, wala binti yako, wala mtumwa wako, wala watumishi wako wa kike, wala mnyama wako wa kulugwa, wala mgeni aliye nyumban mwako. Maana kwa siku sita mimi Mwenyezi Mungu niliziumba mbingu na dunia, bahari na vyote vilivyomo, kisha nikapumzika siku ya saba Kwa hiyo mimi Mwenyezi Mungu nilibariki siku ya Sabato, nikaitakasa.
Amin, Bwana, uturehemu, utujalie neema tuweze kuitii amri hii.
Waheshimu baba yako na mama yako, ili uishi maisha marefu katika nchi ninayokupa mimi Mwenyezi Mungu, Mungu wako.
